author: timbeiko
content: I'm OK with that generally, but not 100% sure I can attend all of them - have a conflict next Fri ðŸ˜… That said, I don't think I'm the main driver here...! Anyone opposed to making it recurring by default? 2 weeks seems like a good cadence until EOY?

author: lightclient
content: is there that much to debate?

author: _shemnon
content: Maybe not a call, perhaps an async status sync?

author: holiman
content: To be clear: are we talking about the tx data eof? So immediately visible without execution?

author: chfast
content: Yes, initcode is in the tx calldata. No execution is needed, but EOF validation which has `O(n)` complexity.

author: chfast
content: <@543900561460822016> , <@425343240212971521> is working on ~~EOF Functions~~ RJUMP implementation in geth so maybe coordinate/cooperate.

author: chfast
content:
The EIP-3670 update: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/5894
Maybe sign-off, leave a comment if you think this is fine.

author: holiman
content: Spontaneously, I'd agree with <@543900561460822016> . Can't see how that pure computational validation could be any worse than the existing validations against state (balance, nonce).

author: holiman
content:
And, balance/nonce err is not trivially attributable. The remote part may have a different head, and just because X is inexist for me, it doesn't mean that it was for the peer who sent it to me. So I can't really blame him. 


Whereas for EOF invalid, that's obviously wrong, and he shouldn't have sent it. That should result in insta-drop.

author: lightclient
content: <@&861652182781001758> have you guys thought about how to modify the tracing format to support EOF?

author: chfast
content: It should works as it is, where is the problem?

author: chfast
content: Having a page like this should be enough for now: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/blob/master/Breakout-Room/4844-readiness-checklist.md

author: lightclient
content: well pc doesn't map directly to code so i think you'd want to expose the code section you're in?

author: chfast
content: Ah yes (I had to check this). If you want uniform trace entries, you can do `fn=3, pc=12` or `pc="3/12"`.

author: chfast
content: I have "begin call" and "end call" additional trace entries in evmone. These are nice to see where a call starts/ends and you can dump depth, input, output, error, gas usage, etc there. Accordingly, you can have "begin function"/"end function" entries.
